DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to identify salivary biomarkers for monitoring cardiometabolic risk in children. The study hypothesis is that a combination of salivary biomarkers will predict the presence of risk factors including impaired fasting glucose, hypertension and dyslipidemia and will reflect changes in these risk factors over time.
DOC.brief_title: Noninvasive Biomarkers for Monitoring Cardiometabolic Risk in Children
DOC.criteria: Participating in the CARDIAC Boot Camp Program Between the ages of 4 and 17 Parental permission Ability to provide assent Inability to comply with saliva collection procedures Renal insufficiency or juvenile gout
